experience.title: Master's In English
experience.details: International Conference On Indian Linguistic Tradition And Indigenous Knowledge System: Echoes of the past: Oral Traditions and the Preservation of India's Cultural Identity
achievements: Analyzed folk tales, songs, and myths as carriers of collective memory and identity
Explored the role of storytelling in sustaining indigenous values and histories across generations
Investigated the impact of modernization and globalization on traditional oral practices

papers.title: Constructing Worth in a Patriarchal World in Mamang Dai's The Legends of Pensam
highlights: Textual analysis highlights how women in male-dominated societies are persecuted, particularly women from Northeast India
Edward Said's concept of 'othering' to illustrate the social isolation and stigmatization experienced by widows in tribal society

papers.title: English and illiteracy, both are opposing houses on the same street
highlights: Researched the arrival, development, and current status of the English language in India
Analyzed the influence of English on Indian youth and illiterate populations
Conducted a case study on uneducated individuals fluent in spoken English
Discovered that some illiterate speakers exhibit stronger oral English skills than formally educated graduates
Explored the socio-linguistic factors contributing to English fluency among non-literate speakers

papers.title: Peter Pan as Children's Literature Text
